titles.title: Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” (the first half of the year)

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” for the first half of the year (fols. 2ra-183vb) I-1) Mäskäräm (fols. 2ra-31vc) I-2) Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 32ra-58vb) I-3) Ḫǝdar (fols. 59ra-86vc) - Zä-ʾaqräbku maḫletä... “The song I am offering...”: fol. 66va I-4) Taḫśaś (fols. 87ra-119vc) I-5) Ṭǝrr (fols. 120ra-157vc) I-6) Yäkkatit (fols. 158ra-183vb) The commemorative notices are followed by ʿarke-hymns
Additiones 1-5; colophon.

nmcopyists.nmcopyist: Zä-Wäldä Maryam and four other scribes

copyists.copyist: Five scribes were involved in the copying of the Ms. Zä-Wäldä Maryam copied the sections for Mäskäräm and Ṭǝqǝmt (quires I-VII); his name is written in the bottom margin of fols. 2r and 58vb. Bäʾǝdä Maryam copied the section for Ḫǝdar (quires VIII-X); his name is written in the bottom margin of fol. 59r (the same scribe possibly copied Ms. SM-003). Zä-Maryam copied the section for Taḫśaś (quires XI-XIV); his name is written in the bottom margin of fol. 87r. Tǝnsaʾe Krǝstos copied the section for Ṭǝrr (quires XV-XVII); his name is written in the bottom margin of fol. 120r. Täsfa Mikaʾel copied the sections for Ṭǝrr and Yäkkatit (quires XVIII-XXII); his name is written in the bottom margin of fols. 144r, 158r, 183vb.

donors.donor: Gäbrǝʾel is mentioned as the commissioner in the concluding supplication formulas for Ṭǝqǝmt (fol. 58vb) and Yäkkatit (fol. 183vb). His name is also mentioned in the supplication formulas for Ṭǝqǝmt and Ḫǝdar (e.g., fols. 39vb, 40va, 43rb, 49rc, 51vb, 55ra, 86vb). Zä-Śǝllase and the community of the church of ʾAbunä ʾArägawi are mentioned in supplication formulas throughout the Ms. (e.g., fols. 2ra, 2vb, 9rb, 34ra, 60va, 91rb, 139rc, 171ra). Bǝʾǝse ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer is mentioned in supplication formulas for Ṭǝqǝmt (e.g., fols. 34rb, 40va, 47rc, 51vb, 58va).

owners.owner: The Ms. might be linked to the collection of Mäqdäla Mädḫane ʿAläm.

txstates.txstate: The reddish-brown tooled leather cover is missing; only turn-ins are preserved. Remains of the pastedowns (?) are visible on the inner faces of both boards. The original sewing has been damaged and repaired. Half of the tailband is missing. A hole of a square shape has been cut out on fol. 71, with a loss of text. Fol. 72 is reinforced with a parchment strip (?). Holes are amended on fols. 57, 132, 139, 155, 164.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with brown leather (quarter cover); reddish-brown tooled leather cover is missing (only turn-ins are preserved); textile inlays. Remains of pastedowns are visible on the inner sides of both boards. Three pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornaments on the reddish-brown leather turn-ins (at least 2 tools were used: double line fillet, triple line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches or their traces at the spine cover Holes or tears visible in the centrefold of the quires, close to the head and tail of the codex. Quire XVI is reinforced by a parchment guard in the centrefold.

squires.squire: I(9; s.l.: 1, stub after 9/fols. 1r-9v) — ፪II(8/fols. 10r-17v) — ፫III(8/fols. 18r-25v) — ፬IV(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 26r-33v) — ፭V(8/fols. 34r-41v) — ፮VI(8/fols. 42r-49v) — ፯VII(9; s.l.: 8, stub after 1/fols. 50r-58v) — ፰VIII(8/fols. 59r-66v) — ፱IX(8/fols. 67r-74v) — ፲X(12/fols. 75r-86v) — [፲፩]XI(8/fols. 87r-94v) — ፲፪XII(8/fols. 95r-102v) — ፲፫XIII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 103r-110v) — ፲፬XIV(9; s.l.: 8, stub after 1/fols. 111r-119v) — ፲፭XV(8/fols. 120r-127v) — ፲፮XVI(8/fols. 128r-135v) — ፲፯XVII(8/fols. 136r-143v) —፲፰XVIII(8/fols. 144r-151v) — ፲፱XIX(8/fols. 152r-159v) — ፳XX(8/fols. 160r-167v) — ፳፩XXI(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 168r-175v) — ፳፪XXII(8/fols. 176r-183v) — B(2/fols. 184r-185v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible (e.g., fols. 71, 91). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The hands are very similar to each other. They are characterized by broadly spaced, slender and round letters. Hand a: fols. 2ra-58vb Hand b: fols. 59ra-86vc: tends to right-sloping script. Hand c: fols. 87ra-119vc Hand d: fols. 120ra-143vc Hand e: fols. 144ra-183vb

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the scribes, the commissioner and two other individuals mentioned in supplication formulas; a few lines (alternating with black lines) and occasionally one group of lines on the incipit page of each section of the text; two initial lines of the first commemorative notice of the day and one initial line of the subsequent commemorative notices of the day; the word sälam “salutation” opening the ʾarke-hymns; names of the months in the upper margin (s. Varia); quire marks; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

colophon.det: The colophon is written in a fine hand, dissimilar to any of the main hands a-e.

additional.cont: Fol. 182vb, vc: Note on the origin of the names Däbrä Halleluya and Däbrä Dammo.
additional.det: Written in a crude hand, the note starts after the colophon, then continues after Additio 2. The content is the same as Additio 3, but it mentions King Täklä Giyorgis.

additional.cont: Fol. 183vc (above): Note on the size of the area occupied by the Däbrä Dammo monastery.
additional.det: The note is written in a mediocre hand, the same as Additio 3. It describes two dimensions, the height and the width, of the monastery. A note added below mentions the name of King Täklä Giyorgis and states that he began to reign in the year 1444 (?).

additional.cont: Fol. 183vc (below): Note on the origin of the names Däbrä Halleluya and Däbrä Dammo.
additional.det: The note is written in the same mediocre hand as Additio 2. The note is repeated on fol. 183vb (below), most probably as a writing exercise.

additional.cont: Fol. 184r: Nägärä wägˀ, Note concerning customary law (?).

extras.extra: - The title of the work, ስንክሳር, is written on the outer face of the front board. - The internal number of the monastic library (384) is written on fol. 1r. - Names of the scribes are written in the bottom margin, on the first and last fols. of the respective text portion. - Omitted ʾarke-hymns and fragments of commemorative notices are written in the upper margin, in one of the main hands: fols. 4rc, 4vbc, 5ra, 32rc, 42vab, 60r, 83r, 97v, 105r, 105v, 122rc, 123vc, 124r. - Omitted ʾarke-hymn is crudely written in the upper margin, in a secondary hand: 42vc-43ra. - Numerous corrections are written over erasures: e.g., fols. 7rb, 12vb, 19rc, 34rb, 49rb, 107rb, 112rc, 131rab, 149rabc, 165rab. - Writing exercises: fols. 183vb, 184ra.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Decorated quire marks are written in the left upper corner of the margin, in red: fols. 10r, 18r, 26r, 34r, 42r, 50r, 59r, 67r, 75r, 87r, 95r, 103r, 111r, 120r, 128r, 136r, 144r, 152r, 160r, 168r, 176r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Names of the months are written in the centre of the upper margin: Mäskäräm: fols. 2r, 10r, 18r, 26r Ṭǝqǝmt: fols. 32r, 34r, 42r, 50r Ḫǝdar: fols. 59r, 66v, 67r, 74v, 75r Taḥśaś: fols. 87r, 95r, 103r, 111r, 119v Ṭǝrr: fols. 120r, 128r, 136r, 144r, 152r Yäkkatit: fols. 158r, 160r, 168r, 176r.
